meta_description: See works of art from antiquity to present day in Wisconsin’s largest art museum, famous for its moving Burke Brise Soleil, or “wings.”
hours_text:
#  Visit

Open today 10 A.M.—5 P.M.

Background video description: Various vignettes showcase how to access the museum from its many entrances and move throughout the galleries. First, following two guests, you enter the main museum space through the underground parking garage elevator. Then, a different guest who rode their bike to the museum exits the Oak Leaf Trail to enter the museum on the East End. Finally, different sets of guests experience the galleries and campus amenities together—viewing and discussing the art on display, playing on the East Lawn, reading a book in reflection spaces, and eating at the Café. 

#  Visit

Open today 10 A.M.—5 P.M.

Open today 10 A.M.—5 P.M.
admission_text:
## Hours

[ See what’s on  ](/whats-on/)

  * ### Kohl’s Art Studio

The [studio](https://mam.org/learn/art-studio/) is open Friday–Sunday, 10 a.m.–4 p.m.

  * ### Thursday Nights at MAM

From 4 to 8 p.m., enjoy art and entertainment with pay-what-you-wish admission.

  * ### Holidays

The Museum is closed Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, and New Year’s Day, and open Christmas Eve until 3 p.m.

Monday–Tuesday | Closed  
---|---  
Wednesday | 10 a.m.–5 p.m.  
Thursday | 10 a.m.–8 p.m.  
Friday–Sunday | 10 a.m.–5 p.m.

collections_text:
#  Be here. ‌‌‌‌  ‌‌  ‌‌ 

Open today 10 A.M.—5 P.M.

Background video description: Various vignettes of the Milwaukee Art Museum campus experience show what it’s like to visit and what guests can expect to see throughout the space—from the white, modern Calatrava building facing Lake Michigan, a child eagerly running toward the entrance off of the Reiman Bridge, and a guest taking in the expanse of Windover Hall to a group of friends enjoying the East Lawn off Oak Leaf Trail, a parent and a child enjoying art in a gallery together, and children painting under a teacher’s instruction at Kohl’s art studio. 

## Plan your visit
